pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:0.5.eng: 51. The training rule on drinking alcoholic drinks

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā cetiyesu cārikaṃ caramāno yena bhaddavatikā tena pāyāsi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.1.eng: On one occasion when the Buddha was wandering in the country of Ceti on his way to Bhaddavatikā,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.2.pli: Addasaṃsu kho gopālakā pasupālakā kassakā pathāvino bhagavantaṃ dūratova āgacchantaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.2.eng: he was seen by a number of cowherds, shepherds, farmers, and travelers.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.2.comm: This a standard group of people also found at MN 50 and MN 86.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.3.pli: Disvāna bhagavantaṃ etadavocuṃ—“mā kho, bhante, bhagavā ambatitthaṃ agamāsi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.3.eng: They said to him, “Sir, don’t go to Ambatittha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.4.pli: Ambatitthe, bhante, jaṭilassa assame nāgo paṭivasati iddhimā āsiviso ghoraviso.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.4.eng: There’s a highly venomous dragon with supernormal powers there, in the hermitage of a dreadlocked ascetic.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.7.eng: They repeated their request a second

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.8.pli: tatiyampi kho gopālakā pasupālakā kassakā pathāvino bhagavantaṃ etadavocuṃ—

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.10.pli: Ambatitthe, bhante, jaṭilassa assame nāgo paṭivasati iddhimā āsiviso ghoraviso.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.13.pli: Atha kho bhagavā anupubbena cārikaṃ caramāno yena bhaddavatikā tadavasari. Tatra sudaṃ bhagavā bhaddavatikāyaṃ viharati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.13.eng: The Buddha then continued on to Bhaddavatikā, and he stayed there.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.14.pli: Atha kho āyasmā sāgato yena ambatitthassa jaṭilassa assamo tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā agyāgāraṃ pavisitvā tiṇasanthārakaṃ paññapetvā nisīdi pallaṅkaṃ ābhujitvā ujuṃ kāyaṃ paṇidhāya parimukhaṃ satiṃ upaṭṭhapetvā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.14.eng: Just then Venerable Sāgata went to the hermitage of that dreadlocked ascetic and entered his fire hut. After preparing a spread of grass, he sat down, crossed his legs, straightened his body, and established mindfulness in front of him.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.15.pli: Addasā kho so nāgo āyasmantaṃ sāgataṃ paviṭṭhaṃ. Disvāna dummano padhūpāyi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.15.eng: Seeing that Sāgata had entered the fire hut, the dragon was upset and emitted smoke.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.17.pli: Atha kho so nāgo makkhaṃ asahamāno pajjali.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.17.eng: The dragon was not able to contain his rage and emitted flames.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.18.eng: Sāgata entered the fire element and he, too, emitted flames.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.19.pli: Atha kho āyasmā sāgato tassa nāgassa tejasā tejaṃ pariyādiyitvā yena bhaddavatikā tenupasaṅkami.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.19.eng: Then, after conquering fire with fire, Sāgata went to Bhaddavatikā.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.20.pli: Atha kho bhagavā bhaddavatikāyaṃ yathābhirantaṃ viharitvā yena kosambī tena cārikaṃ pakkāmi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.20.eng: After staying at Bhaddavatikā for as long as he liked, the Buddha set out wandering toward Kosambī.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.21.pli: Assosuṃ kho kosambikā upāsakā—“ayyo kira sāgato ambatitthikena nāgena saddhiṃ saṅgāmesī”ti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.22.pli: Atha kho bhagavā anupubbena cārikaṃ caramāno yena kosambī tadavasari. Atha kho kosambikā upāsakā bhagavato paccuggamanaṃ karitvā yenāyasmā sāgato tenupasaṅkamiṃsu;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.22.eng: When he arrived, the lay followers there received him.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.23.pli: upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ sāgataṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ aṭṭhaṃsu. Ekamantaṃ ṭhitā kho kosambikā upāsakā āyasmantaṃ sāgataṃ etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.23.eng: But the lay followers at Kosambī had heard about Sāgata fighting the Ambatittha dragon. And so after receiving the Buddha, they went to see Sāgata. They bowed, stood to one side, and said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.24.pli: “kiṃ, bhante, ayyānaṃ dullabhañca manāpañca, kiṃ paṭiyādemā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.24.eng: “Venerable, what can we prepare for you that’s delicious but hard to get?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.25.pli: Evaṃ vutte, chabbaggiyā bhikkhū kosambike upāsake etadavocuṃ—“atthāvuso, kāpotikā nāma pasannā bhikkhūnaṃ dullabhā ca manāpā ca, taṃ paṭiyādethā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.25.eng: The monks from the group of six replied, “There’s a delicious liquor called Kāpotikā, which is hard for the monks to get. Prepare that.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.26.pli: Atha kho kosambikā upāsakā ghare ghare kāpotikaṃ pasannaṃ paṭiyādetvā āyasmantaṃ sāgataṃ piṇḍāya paviṭṭhaṃ disvāna āyasmantaṃ sāgataṃ etadavocuṃ—“pivatu, bhante, ayyo sāgato kāpotikaṃ pasannaṃ, pivatu, bhante, ayyo sāgato kāpotikaṃ pasannan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.26.eng: And the lay followers prepared Kāpotikā in house after house. Then, when they saw that Sāgata had entered the town for alms, they said to him, “Drink, venerable, drink the Kāpotikā liquor.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.27.pli: Atha kho āyasmā sāgato ghare ghare kāpotikaṃ pasannaṃ pivitvā nagaramhā nikkhamanto nagaradvāre paripati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.27.eng: Sāgata drank that liquor in house after house, and as he was leaving town, he collapsed at the town gate.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.28.pli: Atha kho bhagavā sambahulehi bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ nagaramhā nikkhamanto addasa āyasmantaṃ sāgataṃ nagaradvāre paripatantaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.28.eng: Just then the Buddha, together with a number of monks, was also leaving town, and he saw Sāgata at the town gate.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.30.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho te bhikkhū bhagavato paṭissuṇitvā āyasmantaṃ sāgataṃ ārāmaṃ netvā yena bhagavā tena sīsaṃ katvā nipātesuṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.30.eng: Saying, “Yes, sir,” they led him to the monastery, where they put him down with his head toward the Buddha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.31.pli: Atha kho āyasmā sāgato parivattitvā yena bhagavā tena pāde karitvā seyyaṃ kappesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.31.eng: But Sāgata turned around, pointing his feet toward the Buddha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.32.pli: Atha kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi—“nanu, bhikkhave, pubbe sāgato tathāgate sagāravo ahosi sappatisso”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.32.eng: The Buddha said, “Previously, monks, wasn’t Sāgata respectful and deferential toward me?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.34.pli: “Api nu kho, bhikkhave, sāgato etarahi tathāgate sagāravo sappatisso”ti?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.36.pli: “Nanu, bhikkhave, sāgato ambatitthikena nāgena saddhiṃ saṅgāmesī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.36.eng: “Just recently, didn’t Sāgata fight the Ambatittha dragon?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.38.pli: “Api nu kho, bhikkhave, sāgato etarahi pahoti nāgena saddhiṃ saṅgāmetun”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.38.eng: “Would he now be able to fight a dragon?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.40.pli: “Api nu kho, bhikkhave, taṃ pātabbaṃ yaṃ pivitvā visaññī assā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.40.eng: “So, monks, should one drink that which makes one senseless?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.42.pli: “Ananucchavikaṃ, bhikkhave, sāgatassa ananulomikaṃ appatirūpaṃ assāmaṇakaṃ akappiyaṃ akaraṇīyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.42.eng: “It’s not suitable, monks, it’s not proper for Sāgata, it’s not worthy of a monastic, it’s not allowable, it’s not to be done.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.43.pli: Kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, sāgato majjaṃ pivissati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.43.eng: How could Sāgata drink alcoholic drinks?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.45.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.45.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:1.46.1.eng: ‘If a monk drinks this or that kind of alcoholic drink, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:2.1.2.eng: alcoholic drinks made from flour, alcoholic drinks made from cookies, alcoholics drink made from rice, those with yeast added, those made from a combination of ingredients.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:2.1.4.eng: alcoholic drinks made from flowers, alcoholic drinks made from fruit, alcoholic drinks made from honey, alcoholic drinks made from sugar, those made from a combination of ingredients.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:2.1.6.eng: if he drinks even what fits on the tip of a blade of grass, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:2.2.1.eng: If it is an alcoholic drink, and he perceives it as such, and he drinks it, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:2.2.2.eng: If it is an alcoholic drink, but he is unsure of it, and he drinks it, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:2.2.3.eng: If it is an alcoholic drink, but he perceives it as non-alcoholic, and he drinks it, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:2.2.4.eng: If it is a non-alcoholic drink, but he perceives it as alcoholic, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:2.2.5.eng: If it is a non-alcoholic drink, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:2.2.6.eng: If it is a non-alcoholic drink, and he perceives it as such, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:2.3.2.pli: amajjañca hoti majjavaṇṇaṃ majjagandhaṃ majjarasaṃ taṃ pivati,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:2.3.2.eng: if he drinks a non-alcoholic drink that has the color, smell, or taste of an alcoholic drink;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:2.3.3.eng: if it is cooked in a bean curry;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:2.3.4.eng: if it is cooked with meat;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:2.3.5.eng: if it is cooked with oil;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:2.3.6.eng: if it is in syrup from emblic myrobalan;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:2.3.7.eng: if he drinks a drink that is normally alcoholic, but which is actually without alcohol;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:2.3.9.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc51:2.3.10.eng: The training rule on drinking alcoholic drinks, the first, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:1.1.eng: On one occasion when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū sattarasavaggiyaṃ bhikkhuṃ aṅgulipatodakena hāsesuṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:1.2.eng: the monks from the group of six tickled one of the monks from the group of seventeen to make him laugh.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:1.3.eng: Not being able to catch his breath, he died.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:1.4.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:1.4.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:1.5.pli: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhū bhikkhuṃ aṅgulipatodakena hāsessantī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:1.5.eng: “How could the monks from the group of six tickle a monk to make him laugh?” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:1.6.pli: “saccaṃ kira tumhe, bhikkhave, bhikkhuṃ aṅgulipatodakena hāsethā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:1.6.eng: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:1.9.pli: kathañhi nāma tumhe, moghapurisā, bhikkhuṃ aṅgulipatodakena hāsessatha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:1.9.eng: “Foolish men, how could you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:1.11.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:1.11.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:1.12.1.eng: ‘If a monk tickles someone, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.1.2.pli: upasampanno upasampannaṃ hasādhippāyo kāyena kāyaṃ āmasati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.1.2.eng: if one who is fully ordained makes physical contact with another who is fully ordained, body to body, with the aim of making him laugh, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.2.1.pli: Upasampanne upasampannasaññī aṅgulipatodakena hāseti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.2.1.eng: If the other person is fully ordained, and he perceives him as such, and he tickles him to make him laugh, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.2.2.pli: Upasampanne vematiko aṅgulipatodakena hāseti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.2.2.eng: If the other person is fully ordained, but he is unsure of it, and he tickles him to make him laugh, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.2.3.pli: Upasampanne anupasampannasaññī aṅgulipatodakena hāseti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.2.3.eng: If the other person is fully ordained, but he does not perceive him as such, and he tickles him to make him laugh, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.2.4.eng: If, with his own body, he makes physical contact with something connected to the other monk’s body, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.2.5.eng: If, with something connected to his own body, he makes physical contact with the other monk’s body, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.2.6.eng: If, with something connected to his own body, he makes physical contact with something connected to the other monk’s body, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.2.7.eng: If, by releasing something, he makes physical contact with the other monk’s body, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.2.8.eng: If, by releasing something, he makes physical contact with something connected to the other monk’s body, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.2.9.eng: If, by releasing something, he makes physical contact with something released by the other monk, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.2.10.pli: Anupasampannaṃ kāyena kāyaṃ āmasati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.2.10.eng: If, with his own body, he makes physical contact with the body of someone who is not fully ordained, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.2.11.eng: If, with his own body, he makes physical contact with something connected to the body of someone who is not fully ordained, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.2.12.eng: If, with something connected to his own body, he makes physical contact with the body of someone who is not fully ordained, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.2.13.eng: If, with something connected to his own body, he makes physical contact with something connected to the body of someone who is not fully ordained, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.2.14.eng: If, by releasing something, he makes physical contact with the body of someone who is not fully ordained, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.2.15.eng: If, by releasing something, he makes physical contact with something connected to the body of someone who is not fully ordained, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.2.16.eng: If, by releasing something, he makes physical contact with something released by the someone who is not fully ordained, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.2.17.eng: If the other person is not fully ordained, but he perceives them as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.2.18.eng: If the other person is not fully ordained, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.2.19.eng: If the other person is not fully ordained, and he does not perceive them as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.3.2.eng: if he is not aiming to make him laugh;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.3.3.eng: if he makes physical contact with him when there is a need;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.3.5.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.3.6.eng: The training rule on tickling, the second, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:1.1.eng: On one occasion when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sattarasavaggiyā bhikkhū aciravatiyā nadiyā udake kīḷanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:1.2.eng: the monks from the group of seventeen were playing in the water of the river Aciravatī.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:1.3.pli: Tena kho pana samayena rājā pasenadi kosalo mallikāya deviyā saddhiṃ uparipāsādavaragato hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:1.3.eng: Just then, while King Pasenadi of Kosala was up in his finest stilt house with Queen Mallikā,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:1.4.pli: Addasā kho rājā pasenadi kosalo sattarasavaggiye bhikkhū aciravatiyā nadiyā udake kīḷante.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:1.4.eng: he saw the monks from the group of seventeen playing in the river.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:1.6.eng: “Mallikā, these perfected ones are playing in the water.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:1.7.eng: “Great king, no doubt the Buddha hasn’t laid down a rule.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:1.8.eng: Either that, or these monks are ignorant.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:1.9.pli: Atha kho rañño pasenadissa kosalassa etadahosi—

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:1.10.pli: “kena nu kho ahaṃ upāyena bhagavato ca na āroceyyaṃ, bhagavā ca jāneyya ime bhikkhū udake kīḷitā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:1.10.eng: “How can the Buddha find out about these monks playing in the water without me telling him?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:1.11.pli: Atha kho rājā pasenadi kosalo sattarasavaggiye bhikkhū pakkosāpetvā mahantaṃ guḷapiṇḍaṃ adāsi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:1.11.eng: Having sent for those monks, King Pasenadi gave them a large lump of sugar, saying,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:1.12.eng: “Sirs, please give this lump of sugar to the Buddha.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:1.13.pli: Sattarasavaggiyā bhikkhū taṃ guḷapiṇḍaṃ ādāya yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṃsu;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:1.13.eng: The monks took the lump of sugar, went to the Buddha,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:1.15.pli: “imaṃ, bhante, guḷapiṇḍaṃ rājā pasenadi kosalo bhagavato detī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:1.15.eng: “Sir, this lump of sugar is a gift from King Pasenadi.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:1.16.eng: “But, monks, where did you see the king?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:1.17.eng: “From the river Aciravatī, while playing in the water.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:1.19.pli: kathañhi nāma tumhe, moghapurisā, udake kīḷissatha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:1.19.eng: “Foolish men, how can you play in water?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:1.21.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:1.21.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:1.22.1.eng: ‘If a monk plays in water, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:2.1.2.pli: uparigopphake udake hasādhippāyo nimujjati vā ummujjati vā palavati vā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:2.1.2.eng: if, aiming to have fun, he immerses himself or emerges on the surface or swims in water that is more than ankle deep, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:2.2.1.eng: If he is playing in water, and he perceives that he is, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:2.2.2.eng: If he is playing in water, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:2.2.3.eng: If he is playing in water, but he does not perceive that he is, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:2.2.4.eng: If he is playing in water less than ankle deep, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:2.2.5.eng: If he is playing in a boat in water, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:2.2.6.pli: Hatthena vā pādena vā kaṭṭhena vā kaṭhalāya vā udakaṃ paharati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:2.2.6.eng: If he strikes the water with his hand, with his foot, with a stick, or with a stone, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:2.2.7.pli: Bhājanagataṃ udakaṃ vā kañjikaṃ vā khīraṃ vā takkaṃ vā rajanaṃ vā passāvaṃ vā cikkhallaṃ vā kīḷati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:2.2.7.eng: If he plays with water in a vessel, or with congee, milk, buttermilk, dye, urine, or mud in a vessel, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:2.2.8.eng: If he is not playing in water, but he perceives that he is, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:2.2.9.eng: If he is not playing in water, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:2.2.10.eng: If he is not playing in water, and he does not perceive that he is, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:2.3.2.eng: if he is not aiming to have fun;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:2.3.3.pli: sati karaṇīye udakaṃ otaritvā nimujjati vā ummujjati vā palavati vā,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:2.3.3.eng: if, when there is something to be done, he enters the water and then immerses himself or emerges on the surface or swims;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:2.3.4.pli: pāraṃ gacchanto nimujjati vā ummujjati vā palavati vā,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:2.3.4.eng: if, while crossing a body of water, he immerses himself or emerges on the surface or swims;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:2.3.7.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc53:2.3.8.eng: The training rule on playing, the third, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc54:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc54:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā kosambiyaṃ viharati ghositārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc54:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Kosambī in Ghosita’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc54:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā channo anācāraṃ ācarati.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc54:1.6.eng: and he just did it again out of disrespect.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc54:1.7.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc54:1.7.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized him,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc54:1.9.eng: “Is it true, Channa, that you do this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc54:1.12.pli: kathañhi nāma tvaṃ, moghapurisa, anādariyaṃ karissasi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc54:1.12.eng: “Foolish man, how can you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc54:1.14.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc54:1.14.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc54:1.15.1.eng: ‘If a monk is disrespectful, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc54:2.1.2.eng: there are two kinds of disrespect: disrespect for the person and disrespect for the rule.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc54:2.1.4.pli: upasampannena paññattena vuccamāno— “ayaṃ ukkhittako vā vambhito vā garahito vā, imassa vacanaṃ akataṃ bhavissatī”ti anādariyaṃ karoti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc54:2.1.4.eng: if, when corrected by one who is fully ordained about a rule that has been laid down, he thinks, “They’ve been ejected,” “They’ve been reproved,” or “They’ve been censured,” and then, “I won’t do what they say,” and he acts disrespectfully, then he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc54:2.1.6.pli: upasampannena paññattena vuccamāno— “kathāyaṃ nasseyya vā vinasseyya vā antaradhāyeyya vā”, taṃ vā na sikkhitukāmo anādariyaṃ karoti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc54:2.1.6.eng: if, when corrected by one who is fully ordained about a rule that has been laid down, he thinks, “What can be done so that this rule is lost?” “What can be done so that it perishes?”  or “What can be done so that it disappears?” or he does not want to train in that rule, and he acts disrespectfully, then he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc54:2.2.1.pli: Upasampanne upasampannasaññī anādariyaṃ karoti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc54:2.2.1.eng: If the other person is fully ordained, and he perceives them as such, and he acts disrespectfully, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc54:2.2.2.pli: Upasampanne vematiko anādariyaṃ karoti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc54:2.2.2.eng: If the other person is fully ordained, but he is unsure of it, and he acts disrespectfully, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc54:2.2.3.pli: Upasampanne anupasampannasaññī anādariyaṃ karoti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc54:2.2.3.eng: If the other person is fully ordained, but he does not perceive them as such, and he acts disrespectfully, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc54:2.2.4.eng: If, when corrected about something that has not been laid down, he thinks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc54:2.2.5.pli: “idaṃ na sallekhāya na dhutatthāya na pāsādikatāya na apacayāya na vīriyārambhāya saṃvattatī”ti anādariyaṃ karoti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc54:2.2.5.eng: “This isn’t conducive to self-effacement,” “This isn’t conducive to ascetic practices,” “This isn’t conducive to being inspiring,” “This isn’t conducive to a reduction in things,” or “This isn’t conducive to being energetic,” and he acts disrespectfully, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc54:2.2.6.pli: Anupasampannena paññattena vā apaññattena vā vuccamāno—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc54:2.2.6.eng: If, when corrected by one who is not fully ordained, whether or not it has been laid down, he thinks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc54:2.2.7.pli: “idaṃ na sallekhāya na dhutatthāya na pāsādikatāya na apacayāya na vīriyārambhāya saṃvattatī”ti anādariyaṃ karoti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc54:2.2.7.eng: “This isn’t conducive to self-effacement,” “This isn’t conducive to ascetic practices,” “This isn’t conducive to being inspiring,” “This isn’t conducive to a reduction in things,” or “This isn’t conducive to being energetic,” and he acts disrespectfully, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc54:2.2.8.eng: If the other person is not fully ordained, but he perceives them as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc54:2.2.9.eng: If the other person is not fully ordained, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc54:2.2.10.eng: If the other person is not fully ordained, and he does not perceive them as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc54:2.3.2.eng: if he says, “This is how we were taught and tested by our teachers;”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc54:2.3.2.comm: “Testing” renders paripuccha. The basic meaning of paripucchā is “to question” or “to ask”, as used for instance in Bu Pc 71. Often, however, as in the present case, it refers to a teacher questioning his student, in the sense of finding out how much the student knows. In such cases I render the word as “testing”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc54:2.3.4.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc54:2.3.5.eng: The training rule on disrespect, the fourth, is finished.
